page.title: 03PLACES OF WORSHIP CONTINUED
page.content: Jehovah's Witnesses go to meetings every Tuesday. The Elders are responsible for leading our service. We sing songs about Jesus and God. We go round to people's houses in small groups and tell them about our religion. The Sikhs' religious building id called a Gurdwara. Before we go in we have to take off our shoes and cover our heads with a handkerchief or turban, then we wash our hands. The Guru, our holy man, sits in a special place and reads the holy book, the Guru Granth Sahib. We listen to the reading and pray. Ladies sit on one side of the carpet and men on the other side.
